trans-unit.source: Represents a group of related sections within a configuration file.
Settings in configuration files (such as the Web.config file) are organized into sections.
Because some sections are related, it is often convenient to group them in a section group.

The <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup> class represents the `sectionGroup` XML element that is used to group sections when they are defined in the `configSections` element of a configuration file.
Section groups can be nested (a section group can contain other section groups as well as sections).
The following example shows a `configSections` element that defines three nested section groups:
The configuration system loads settings from configuration files into <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup> objects.

You can use the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup.Sections%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup.SectionGroups%2A> properties to access the sections and section groups that are contained in a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup> object.
For more information about how to access information from configuration files, see the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> class.
Forces the declaration for this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup.ForceDeclaration%2A> method can force a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup> object to be written to a configuration file, even if it is not required because it is already declared in a parent file.
Forces the declaration for this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup.ForceDeclaration%2A> method forces this <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup> declaration to be written to the file if `force` is `true`.
If `force` is `false`, this action might be ignored if the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup> object is required by the system.

The <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup.ForceDeclaration%2A> method can force a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup> object to be written to a configuration file, even if it is not required because it is already declared in a parent file.
Also, it can remove a group from a configuration file if the group is not required.

You might want to use the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup.ForceDeclaration%2A> method to make a configuration file more portable from one computer to another, without worrying about whether the group declaration already exists.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object is the root section group.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object has a location.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object declaration is required.
`true` if this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> declaration is required; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object is declared.
If the section group is declared in the configuration file, the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup.IsDeclared%2A> property returns `true`.
The <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup.IsDeclared%2A> property returns `false` if this section is inherited from Machine.config or a parent configuration file.
`true` if this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> is declared; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets the name property of this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup.Name%2A> property value is the name of the section group that does not contain the parent section groups.
The name property of this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object.
Gets the section group name associated with this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup.SectionGroupName%2A> property value is the full path name of the section group, including the parent section groups..
The section group name of this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object.

Gets a <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroupCollection"></xref> object that contains all the <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> objects that are children of this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object.

A <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroupCollection"></xref> object that contains all the <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> objects that are children of this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object.

Gets a <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionCollection"></xref> object that contains all of <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection"></xref> objects within this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object.

A <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionCollection"></xref> object that contains all the <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection"></xref> objects within this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object.

Indicates whether the current <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> instance should be serialized when the configuration object hierarchy is serialized for the specified target version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].

Each configuration section group that is created for the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] and later versions must explicitly override this method and return `true`, but only if the section group is valid for the specified version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
Existing configuration section groups that were created for earlier versions of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] do not have to be changed.
The base type contains a default implementation of this method that always returns `true`.
In other words, if a configuration section group implementer does not override this method, by default the configuration section group will be serialized for all framework versions.
The target version of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
`true` if the current section group should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the type for this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object.

If this instance of the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup> class is a derived type, the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup.Type%2A> property will return the name of the derived type that extends the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup> class.
The type of this <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object is the root section group.
\- or -
The <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup"></xref> object has a location.
The section or group is already defined at another level.
